results.title: You and your school council
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Mark Laughlin and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Highlights the new roles and responsibilities of school councils. Emphasizes the participation of parents, students and teachers in school governance; and the importance of collaborative decision making in developing school policies and priorities. Encourages parents to become involved in school councils.

results.title: Seeing by numbers
results.creator_credit: Janice Kay, Bob Thorpe and London Television Service
results.brief_description: Presents the history of information from the 13th century and the new ways we can communicate. Shows everyday applications of numerical analysis in such areas as weather forecasting, telephone information systems, education and business.

results.title: The Top few inches
results.creator_credit: Jerry Krepakevich and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Depicts impact of farming on the soils of Canada from the 1930s to the present. Shows soil erosion caused by poor farming techniques as well as leaching and salting due to irrigation. Emphasizes new practice of zero tillage and presents solutions to soil and land management.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Krepakevich and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Menzies visits Malaya
results.brief_description: Records the welcome given to Sir Robert Menzies during his five day goodwill visit to Malaya in 1959. Shows Menzies swapping gifts with Tunku Abdul Rahman, visiting Parliament and reviewing Australian troops while Dame Pattie Menzies visits the hospital and speaks to the Women’s Institute. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Rachel Dustbin's dog and the law
results.creator_credit: Murray Reece and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the law making process through the example of Rachel and her dog. Rachel’s dog is a noisy dancing dog who attracts spectators from everywhere. The noise upsets the neighbours who lobby to introduce a law against noisy dogs. Highlights process of bringing a law into being from drafting stage to becoming an act of law. Animated film. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Promise in the sky
results.creator_credit: Bill Metcalfe, Judy Davison and London Television Service
results.brief_description: Uses special effects to show how the new generation of European and American satellites are being used to preserve life on earth. Includes glimpses of earth from outer space.

results.title: Hunters and collectors: the way to go out
results.creator_credit: Andrew de Groot, Julie Stone and Human Fraility
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of film clips and live tracks featuring the work of the band The Hunters and collectors. The filmclips comprise: “Talking to a stranger”, “Lumps of lead”, “Judas sheep”. Live traks include “The Way to go out”, “The Slab”, “Throw your arms around me”, “I couldnt give it to you”, “Chalkie”, “The Umbeliever”, “Carry me”, “I believe”.

results.title: Soldering
results.brief_description: Indicates that soldering plays a vital part in modern electronics and that it is esential to understand the art of soldering if becoming involved in this field. Provides the theory and demostrates the practical processes. No other credits available

results.title: Assembly tools
results.brief_description: Features the methods for mounting various types of components and demonstrates different methods of attaching leads through the board. Shows correct orientation of components and suggestions for handling sensitive components.

results.title: Fabrication
results.brief_description: Shows how to make circuit boards. The procedure for making a negative from master artwork is clearly outlined before the method for developing and etching a printed circuit board is covered.
